intro: Caruelina sessilis, commonly known as the sessile caruelina, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, typically with five petals. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
